IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Avenidas provides support, information and community to enrich the lives of older adults and their families. Its continuum of services support individuals who are aging in place, in their own homes, and include enrichment activities, practical help services, health and wellness programs and adult day health care for the frail elderly.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Avenidas provides support, information and community to enrich the lives of older adults and their families.
IRS990.Description: SDHC: Adult Day Health Care providing transportation, nutrition, recreation and health services (including nursing care physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy) to frail seniors. (13,951 days of service to 413 clients)

Activity2.Description: Avenidas Village: Providing social, supportive, practical and other services to older adult members in support of maintaining their independence in their own homes. (303 clients)

Activity3.Description: Participant Services: Providing reception, registration and membership services to older adults, facilitating the provision of health and wellness, education, recreation and social services. (11,461 registrations and 1,700 members)

ActivityOther.Description: Additional Programs including Social Work Services, Lifelong Learning and Leisure, Health Services, Volunteer Services.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The organization has adopted investment and spending policies for endowment assets that attempt to provide a predictable stream of funding to programs supported by its endowment while seeking to maintain the purchasing power of the endowment assets. The organization has a policy of appropriating for distribution each year a portion (within a range of 4 to 5%) of its endowment fund's average fair value over the prior 12 quarters through the calendar year-end preceding the fiscal year in which the distribution is planned.

Avenidas is exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c) (3) of the Internal Revenue Service Code and Section 23701(d) of the State of California Revenue and Taxation Code. In addition, Avenidas has been determined by the Internal Revenue Service not to be a private foundation within the meaning of Section 509(a) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued new guidance on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes. Avenidas adopted this new guidance for the year ended June 30, 2010. Management evaluated Avenidas' tax positions and concluded that Avenidas had maintained its tax exempt status and had taken no uncertain tax position that required adjustment to the financial statements. Therefore, no provision or liability for income taxes has been included in the financial statements.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Board establishes the the compensation for the organization's Chief Executive Officer and reviews the compensation of the Chief Financial Officer.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors has delegated responsibility for review of Form 990 to the Audit Committee of the Board; such Committee does review the return before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Conflict of Interest compliance is reviewed annually at a Board meeting. Every Board Member and organization manager is required to sign the organization's "Conflict of Interest and Disclosure Statement" annually. Any disclosed events, transactions, arrangements or other situations deemed to be potentially a conflict of interest are discussed with the full Board and voted on as necessary.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CEO/President and Vice President, Finance and Administration: Executive Committee of the Board reviews compensation as compared with published market data of comparable non-profits in vicinity. The process for both positions is done annually and was last undertaken in May 2010.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are all available upon request. In addition the organization's Form 990 is available on an independent website. Financial statements are published in summary on the organization's website and in its annual report.
The organization did not change either its oversight process or selection process during the tax year.
